attributes.action: Stop the "Christmas bubble" due to a significant increase in Coronavirus cases.
attributes.additional_details:
Cases are increasing in many areas of the country.  Encouraging (or not discouraging) travel and mixing is not sensible at this stage and will likely increase the load on the NHS and potentially lead to them being overwhelmed in January when they will already be overburdened with winter pressures. 
We should be taking measures based on the virus and the NHS, not on sentiment.
attributes.background: Reverse the "Christmas bubble" idea. It is just a holiday and people can manage as they did in other holidays this year.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Do not compromise the lockdown rules for Christmas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553660

Since you started your petition the Government has restricted the relaxation of Covid-19 rules over the Christmas period. You can read the current rules here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/making-a-christmas-bubble-with-friends-and-family/making-a-christmas-bubble-with-friends-and-family
